001package org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.jsonrpc;
002
003import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Single;
004import org.bitcoinj.base.Network;
005import org.bitcoinj.core.Block;
006import org.bitcoinj.base.Sha256Hash;
007import org.consensusj.bitcoin.json.pojo.ChainTip;
008import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.BitcoinClient;
009import io.reactivex.rxjava3.core.Flowable;
010import org.consensusj.bitcoin.jsonrpc.BitcoinExtendedClient;
011import org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.ChainTipService;
012import org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.zeromq.RxBitcoinZmqService;
013import org.consensusj.bitcoinj.util.BlockUtil;
014
015import javax.net.ssl.SSLContext;
016import javax.net.ssl.SSLSocketFactory;
017import java.net.URI;
018
019/**
020 * A {@link BitcoinClient} enhanced with Reactive features. Can use either ZeroMQ or polling
021 * to implement {@link RxJsonChainTipClient}.
022 * <p>
023 * TODO: answer the below questions
024 * <p>
025 * Should this class eventually implement {@link org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.RxBlockchainService}
026 * or {@link org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.RxBlockchainBinaryService}?
027 * <p>
028 * Should this class be renamed to {@code RxBitcoinJsonRpcClient} and the {@code RxBitcoinClient} interface be moved
029 * to {@code cj-btc-rx?}
030 */
031public class RxBitcoinClient extends BitcoinExtendedClient implements RxJsonChainTipClient {
032    ChainTipService chainTipService;
033
034    public RxBitcoinClient(Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword) {
035        this(network, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword, true);
036    }
037
038    public RxBitcoinClient(Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword, boolean useZmq) {
039        this(getDefaultSSLContext(), network, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword, useZmq);
040    }
041
042    public RxBitcoinClient(SSLContext sslContext, Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword, boolean useZmq) {
043        super(sslContext, network, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
044        // TODO: Determine if ZMQ is available by querying the server
045        // TODO: Determine whether server is up or down -- add a session re-establishment service
046        if (useZmq) {
047            chainTipService = new RxBitcoinZmqService(this);
048        } else {
049            chainTipService = new PollingChainTipServiceImpl(this);
050        }
051    }
052
053    @Deprecated
054    public RxBitcoinClient(SSLSocketFactory sslSocketFactory, Network network, URI server, String rpcuser, String rpcpassword, boolean useZmq) {
055        super(sslSocketFactory, network, server, rpcuser, rpcpassword);
056        if (useZmq) {
057            chainTipService = new RxBitcoinZmqService(this);
058        } else {
059            chainTipService = new PollingChainTipServiceImpl(this);
060        }
061    }
062
063    @Override
064    public Flowable<ChainTip> chainTipPublisher() {
065        return Flowable.fromPublisher(chainTipService.chainTipPublisher());
066    }
067
068    /**
069     * Convert best {@link Block} to active {@link ChainTip}. If BIP34 is activated this
070     * is purely computational, otherwise I/O is required to fetch the {@code ChainTip}
071     *
072     * @param block Input best block
073     * @return active ChainTip assuming this block is the "best block"
074     */
075    public Single<ChainTip> activeChainTipFromBestBlock(Block block) {
076        int height = BlockUtil.blockHeightFromCoinbase(block);
077        if (height != -1) {
078            return Single.just(ChainTip.ofActive(height, block.getHash()));
079        } else {
080            return getActiveChainTipViaRpc();
081        }
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Get the latest (aka "best") {@link Block} via JSON-RPC.
086     * <p>
087     * Generally, you should use the {@link org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.RxBlockchainService} or
088     * {@link org.consensusj.bitcoin.rx.RxBlockchainBinaryService} interface if you
089     * are looking for a reactive interface to blocks, because those interfaces will
090     * be more efficient. This method <b>always</b> composes two unique RPC calls to the server.
091     *
092     * @return A "hot" {@code Single} that will fetch the "best" block via JSON-RPC
093     */
094    public Single<Block> getBestBlockViaRpc() {
095        return getActiveChainTipViaRpc().flatMap(tip -> getBlockSingle(tip.getHash()));
096    }
097
098    private Single<ChainTip> getActiveChainTipViaRpc() {
099        return call(this::getChainTips)
100                .map(ChainTip::findActiveChainTipOrElseThrow);
101    }
102
103    private Single<Block> getBlockSingle(Sha256Hash blockHash) {
104        return call(() -> getBlock(blockHash));
105    }
106}
